summary: Vax and Scanlan have very few solo moments together in campaign one, but I appreciate that when they do have them Liam and Sam...

tags: and if you're wondering where molly is he and vax are bffs in the afterlife and all of the jester stories come from him
summary: the mighty nein meet vox machina
title: the mighty nein meet vox machina
body:
and it’s odd for vex, because she doesn’t know why this scrappy, dirty man holding to himself a ginger cat who looks mildly put-upon, one of this large group she has been beckoned to welcome into her immaculate home, stands out to her. he looks like he wants to blend into the background, as though the fine furnishings around him and the regimented way that the guards march through on patrol offend him and put him on edge. he is nothing like vax, and yet there is something about his quiet poise, about the way his eyes dart back and forth, even something in the way he enunciates his words that makes her wonder if his history too is awash in ash and if he will one day overcome the same thing that she and her brother once had to (and have done, though caleb widogast doesn’t seem to have gotten there yet).

percy thinks that the little green-skinned girl (though he’s far too polite to point out her obvious defects in costume) is both charming and disarming in equal measure, though in a great contrast with his bardic friend. her grating chirp of a voice is unexpected and yet so typical of one of her kind, and her fascination with the small shiny bits that he keeps in his workshop are nothing that he didn’t expect. when the occasional brass screw seems to vanish, he knows simply to turn his head the other way and not think too much of it. when her eyes widen and she produces animus from a long-forgotten shelf (and brushes away the thick layer of dust on it), he sees both a fanatic gleam, one that he’s seen before in scanlan’s greed, and a scientific interest in her eyes that makes him pause, trying to decide whether or not he wants to take the gun away from her (far, far, far away) or sit down with nott the brave and take it apart, slowly and surely, explaining every bit of the functionality that the weapon once had when it served him well.

scanlan is amused by fjord. perhaps that is the best way to put it. scanlan is very very amused by how little fjord seems to know his own charm and handsomeness, two things that scanlan has always known that he himself has. he is amused by the blatancy of jester’s flirtatiousness with fjord and by the way that fjord seems uncertain of what to do with it. the half-orc seems troubled in some ways, over a history that is marked by a glowing yellow eye, but scanlan wonders why he doesn’t know that life isn’t always just what happens to you but what you make of it. he hopes that fjord will learn to relax and take what life gives to you. he thinks that fjord thinks too much, and while he wouldn’t recommend the warlock become the spirit of id that grog sometimes is, he does think that fjord might benefit more from that than he thinks.

grog is in awe of yasha the way he is in awe of pike. he fully acknowledges the differences in the two; yasha towers where pike would merely stand, and sarenrae is a kind and mothering goddess whereas the stormlord demands perfection and readiness from his followers. but there is a softness to yasha as there is a hardness to pike, yasha who presses flowers in her books and pike who sprints into battle with a screech and a raised weapon. yasha’s anger in battle stands in stark contrast to grog’s: where his ignites, hers freezes, and yet they seem to bear similar results. truth be told, grog is a bit scared of challenging yasha to a wrestling match, though he knows full well that if she were to ask him to spar, he would agree in no seconds flat.

pike thinks beau is cool. hands down, she’s probably the coolest one there. she stands tall, her chin raised, seeming to not give a single fuck about anyone or anything as long as shit gets done, and pike can respect that. and yet, and yet, there is something in her past. where keyleth holds herself with less-than-confidence in everything, she does have a home, and beau’s confidence can become empty at times and it is those times that pike recognizes the lack of that base. she’s not too worried about it, though; the rest of the group that the human monk is travelling with seems well on their way to becoming as close a group as vox machina ended up as, so perhaps one day beauregard lionett will be able to truly understand what being a part of a family was like.

keyleth is fascinated by the tall figure of caduceus clay, fascinated with his pink hair and his grey skin and the kindness in his large eyes that seems strangely devoid of the analytic, sharp glances of her best friend despite sharing the emotion she has seen from him before. it is strange to relate a man so agnostic and separated from faith to this one who seems to exist in a veil of certainty in the grace of the wildmother, and he is the first of her followers that she has allowed to truly hold and brandish the spire of conflux, not because she distrusts the others, but because she feels that she can trust this one more, that he in his acceptance of all things nature and of the cycle of life that does not feel religious is in some way a better distillation of that goddess’s true beliefs than the others will ever be. she knows that percy would not feel the way that she does, but she senses also that perhaps percy and caduceus would agree on the certainty of some things, the former in the certainty of engineering and the latter in the certainty of the way the world works.

according to what he has been told, vax thinks that jester is adorable. she is what he wishes his sister could have become, in happier times: someone whose only goal is to make another person smile. he hears in fragments of her strange misadventures, of how she adored and protected a small bird child much in the way that his twin adored and protected a set of twin boys in the hells that she should not have tried to save. he thinks that were they to meet, vex would perhaps pull her hair out in the face of the tiefling girl that obsesses over pastries and flings money away at the blink of an eye, but he hopes that in the end she would be able to appreciate the unadulterated sweetness of a soul that knows exactly the price she is paying for everyone else’s joy.

summary: I love your art so much!!! It’s so cute and it’s been such an inspiration for me! (You’re also the reason I got into critical...
question: I love your art so much!!! It’s so cute and it’s been such an inspiration for me! (You’re also the reason I got into critical role and thANK YOU I LOV)
answer:
AKLSDJ THANK YOU I’M GLAD I DRAGGED YOU INTO THE AWESOMENESS THAT IS CRITICAL ROLE SO PLEASE TAKE THIS SUPER QUICK PERCY SKETCH



(I love too)

summary: a broken world, a sudden loss
title: a broken world, a sudden loss
body:
[read on ao3]

there once was a necromancer and a druid. there was no love lost between them; there was only hatred and blistering rage, disgust. one the very antithesis to the other, death and life on opposite sides of a war.

there once was a necromancer who was in love. she loved so fiercely she refused for death to be the end. her husband had sharp fangs, cold skin and a fear of the sun, but he remained at her side. she broke the world for them to be together, no matter what came. then a druid and a little cleric stole him from her, ashes drifting in the wind. the necromancer screamed and cried. no, it couldn’t be, she thought. a broken world and still no love left for her.

there once was a druid who was in love. she loved so, so brightly once she dared to step past the fear of losing. her boyfriend had wings and the goddess of fate and death at his back, but he remained at her side. they found their way alongside each other. then a necromancer and her worshipped god stole him from her, ashes spreading over the ground. she didn’t dare cry, too busy with the fight. it couldn’t be, she thought. she had only just let him in. a paralyzing fear of losing and it all had come to be true.

there once was a necromancer and a druid, their loves ripped from them by the other. they screamed and fought and won and lost.

there once was a necromancer and a druid.

now only the druid remains.

besides what i have which is
how to tell your boyfriend that your a werewolf
summary: Its entirely plausible that Tary never asked Lawrences age and assumed he was older because of the white streaks of hair he...
body:
Its entirely plausible that Tary never asked Lawrences age and assumed he was older because of the white streaks of hair he naturally has.

Tary might have loved him, but he was still a young conceited asshole at the time, who didn’t ask people questions as simple as their names.

It still works.

summary: Hey Critical Role fandom
body:
Hey Critical Role fandom

I’m having some dad-related tragedy right now and I want to watch CR to distract myself, but first I need to know: in Liam’s new werewolf one-shot, did the dad die? Is he dead, surprise a monster, or do they save him? I don’t need to know any other spoilers, but I need to know if I’m signing up to watch a group of siblings mourn their father, because if so, I need to skip it.

blog.name: eirwyn
blog.title: You blink, and it's just feathers
blog.description:
Hi. I’m Eirwyn. It’s a unisex name. I’m a girl.
I’m an ex-pat of the Glee fandom but have now mostly moved on to other things. I obsess so you’ll notice my blog going through phases. The current phase is Critical Role. Vax and Vex are my smol trash children and Gilmore literally gives me life. 
I also love Shadowhunters, the Marvel Universe in all its incarnations, various poorly known TV shows and web series that deserve far more fans than they have, and a lot of YouTubers. I will post feminist things. I will post ‘social justice’ things. I will talk about myself. I will bitch about work (I have a tag for it).
I’m bisexual. I like queer representation, which is how you can convince me to watch pretty much anything. I’m a graduate. I write. Tumblr is my happy place and my life’s blood and now I have internet access on my phone I am here pretty much all the time. I don’t bite, so feel free to say hi.

summary: So I took a break. I said to myself, September, try September. Give yourself two months to heal, two months to try accept that...
body:
So I took a break. I said to myself, September, try September. Give yourself two months to heal, two months to try accept that horrendous loss. Try again in September.

It’s the first Thursday in September. Time for me to start listening to Critical Role again. Time for me to see if I’m ready for Taliesin to not be Molly.
